content.question: Suppose a country's government increases the allowable deduction for individual retirement accounts per person. Holding all other influences constant, how would this policy action affect the country’s loanable funds market, its production possibilities curve, and its long-run aggregate supply <math alttext="open parenthesis, L R A S, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>LRAS</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> curve?

choices.label: Private savings would decrease and real interest rates would increase in the loanable funds market, the nation’s production possibilities curve would shift inward, and its <math alttext="L R A S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LRAS</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> curve would shift to the left.

Private savings would increase and real interest rates would decrease in the loanable funds market, the nation’s production possibilities curve would shift outward, and its <math alttext="L R A S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LRAS</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> curve would shift to the right.

Public savings would decrease and real interest rates would increase in the loanable funds market, the nation’s production possibilities curve would shift inward, and its <math alttext="L R A S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LRAS</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> curve would shift to the left.

Public savings would increase and real interest rates would decrease in the loanable funds market, the nation’s production possibilities curve would shift outward, and its <math alttext="L R A S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LRAS</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> curve would shift to the right.

National savings would decrease and real interest rates would increase in the loanable funds market, the nation’s production possibilities curve would shift inward, and its <math alttext="L R A S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LRAS</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> curve would shift to the left.

content.answer: Private savings would increase and real interest rates would decrease in the loanable funds market, the nation’s production possibilities curve would shift outward, and its <math alttext="L R A S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LRAS</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> curve would shift to the right.
